New Records: Zimbabwe scored 115 runs in their innings, their first match since 2016 against India.
India's lowest all-out total in T20Is in the last eight years was 102.
Key Match Events: India won the toss and decided to bowl first.
Zimbabwe won the match by 13 runs.
The match was the first of a five-game series.
Pre-Game Insights: India had a young side with debuts for Abhishek Sharma, Riyan Parag, and Dhruv Jurel.
The match had historical significance as it was the first since 2016.
Post-Match Reflections: Shubman Gill expressed disappointment with his dismissal and the team's performance.
Sikandar Raza praised the team's effort and mentioned the need for improvement.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weather in Harare was 25 degrees Celsius and could drop to 15 degrees during the match.
The match was significant following the retirements of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.
Others: The article provided detailed live updates and score tracking throughout the match.
